arrive.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to get to the place you are going to
arrive.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
By the time the police arrived on the scene, the burglars had fled.
What time does the plane arrive in New York?
arrive.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if something arrives, it is brought or delivered to you
arrive.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The card arrived on my birthday.
arrive.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if an event or particular period of time arrives, it happens
arrive.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: When her wedding day arrived, she was really nervous.
arrive.translation[0].definitions[3].def: if a new idea, method, product etc arrives, it begins to exist or starts being used
arrive.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Since computers arrived, my job has become much easier.
arrive.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Sharon’s baby arrived just after midnight.
arrive.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Jo should arrive home any minute now.
I don’t think we should arrive early.
He never arrives on time for meetings.
She phoned to say she had arrived safely.
My parents are due to arrive shortly.
He arrived unannounced yesterday and stayed the night.
It was a great relief when he arrived back safe and sound.
Two more police cars arrived on the scene.
arrive.translation[0].note_box[1].items[: You arrive in a city or country
We arrived in London at 2 am
You arrive at a place such as a house, hotel, or airport
They arrived at the airport at 1030
You  arrive home
He arrived home at midnight
You arrive here/there/back
Call me when you arrive there
arrive to a place
arrive to home
arrive to here/there
You get to a city, country, or other place
We got to London at 2 am
We got to the airport at 1030
You  get home
He got home at midnight
You get here/there/back
Call me when you get there
You  reach a city, country, or other place
The climbers reached the summit of the mountain
You reach home or reach here/there
You should reach there around 945 am
reach to a place
reach to home/here/there
arrive.translation[0].note_box[2].sectio: to get to the place you are going to
I arrived at the party at around 7 o’clock.
They were due to arrive home from Spain yesterday.
to arrive somewhere. Get  is much more common in everyday English than arrive
What time do you usually get to work?
I’ll call you when I get home.
to arrive somewhere, especially after a long journey
When we finally reached the port, we were all very tired.
come
if someone comes, they arrive at the place where you are
She came home yesterday.
What time did the plumber say he’d come?
turn up
to arrive somewhere, especially when someone is waiting for you
I’d arranged to meet Tom, but he never turned up.
roll in
to arrive somewhere later than you should and not seem worried about it
Rebecca usually rolls in around noon.
get in
to arrive somewhere – used especially about people arriving home, or a plane, train etc arriving at an airport, station etc
I usually get in at around 6 o’clock.
What time did your plane get in?
come in
if a plane, train, or ship comes in, it arrives in the place where you are
We liked to watch the cruise ships come in.
if a plane or the passengers on it land, they arrive on the ground
We finally landed at 2 a.m.
They watched the planes taking off and landing.
